Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah conceded only six runs in the 16th and 18th overs, crucial for India's victory.
Suryakumar Yadav took an outstanding catch to dismiss David Miller, ending the game.
Heinrich Klaasen struck a magnificent 23-ball half-century, but his dismissal in the 18th over changed the course of the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Rohit Sharma, India's captain, praised Jasprit Bumrah's performance, saying, 'The emotions can take over, but now the job is done.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India posted 176 runs for the loss of eight wickets, the highest-ever innings score in a T20 World Cup final.
South Africa needed 30 runs off 30 balls but failed to capitalize, needing 20 runs off the last two overs.
